4. District 4

District 4
==========

Council Member D. F. “Rick” Miller, Captain U.S. Navy (ret.)
------------------------------------------------------------

Graduated from the U. S. Naval Academy, Annapolis, Maryland.

Immediately after graduation, participated on the first United States baseball team in exhibition in the Summer Olympics in Mexico. Honored as a inductee in the Naval Academy Sports

Then entered flight training in Pensacola, Florida and was designated a Naval Aviator, making numerous deployments aboard USS Independence (CV-62) to the European theater, flying the A-7E Corsair aircraft.

Progressing to the rank of Captain, held top leadership positions in carrier-based squadrons, shore assignments in the Pentagon on the Joint Staff and the Secretary of the Navy’s staff.

Thirty years career included commanding Attack Squadron Two Zero Five (VA-205), an A-7E squadron, Carrier Air Wing Twenty (CVW-20), and Naval Air Station Dallas, Texas. Has flown all the Navy’s current and former tactical, carrier-based aircraft, including the FA-18, F-14, A-6, A-7, A-4 and F/A-18.

Attended the Industrial College of the Armed Forces at the National Defense University, receiving a Master of Science in National Resource Strategy

Also served as the Senior Fellow on the Chief of Naval Operations Strategic Studies Group (SSG) charged to develop innovative war fighting concepts for the 21st Century Navy. Dialogue with senior officials within the United States government and all military services as well senior officials of foreign countries and their military services.

Personal awards include Defense Superior Service Award; Legion of Merit (3 awards); Meritorious Service Award (2 Awards); and Navy Commendation Award (3 awards).

Following transition from the Navy, assumed a position with Mercuri Urval USA, as a senior consultant involved with organizational improvement and people development programs.  Then served as the Vice President of Administration with Integrated Electrical Services, heading all people programs and the integration of acquired companies.  Also served as a Senior Vice President for Organizational Development with Comfort Systems USA, heading all training and human resource functions.

Founder and President of TREVANIONGROUP, LLC, a firm that develops leadership and high performing teams along with strategic planning and executive coaching with organizations.

Currently serving on the Board of Directors of 2 non-profits...Impact A Hero, and The Warriors Refuge.

Married to Treanne. Older son is an Admiral in the Navy and currently serving as the Deputy Commander, U.S. 6th Fleet…younger son is a District Court Judge in Harris County. Ten grandchildren and one great granddaughter.

Community Involvement:
----------------------

* Former member of the SL Regional Airport Policy Board
* Sugar Land Rotary Board of Directors, three terms
* Finance Chairman, Sugar Creek Baptist Church ($9 million budget), 2 years
* Chairman, Rotary Veterans Tribute 2005, 2007, 2011 (The Legacy of Freedom)
* Retired Texas State Representative, Texas House District 26 (Appropriations, Human Services Committees)
* Founder, former Board Director, of The Sanctuary Foster Care Services (501c3)
* Board of Directors for Impact a Hero (both 501c3s)
* Chairman of the Board of Directors for The Warriors Refuge (501c3)

   Request for Function Participation
   ----------------------------------

   Individuals and organizations wishing to invite the Mayor or Council Members to an event or function are asked to submit the online request form.

   * [Access Request Form](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=J0z5q05gHEa9hEN6y5R3LY1WkZPpbj1Jptu1P-E8CeZUMjZRNkxBMEJMUkhOMDNNTDlFOTBNTUU4Uy4u)

   Please note that requests must be submitted two weeks in advance. The availability of elected officials is not guaranteed.
